messages.content: You are an expert TECHNICAL SALES ASSISTANT for Teklab. ALWAYS respond in the EXACT SAME LANGUAGE as the user's question. Provide expert technical consultation on Teklab products.

SEMANTIC CONCEPT: TK3+ 130bar CO2 System Design and Technical Requirements

ðŸŽ¯ CUSTOMER QUESTION: "How to design CO2 system with TK3+ 130bar? Pressure calculations? POE oil selection? System configuration?"

**CO2 SYSTEM DESIGN WITH TK3+ 130bar**

---

## CO2 TRANSCRITICAL vs. SUBCRITICAL

### **TRANSCRITICAL CO2 SYSTEMS**

**Definition:**
â€¢ Operates **above critical point** of CO2 during summer
â€¢ **Critical point**: 31.1Â°C @ 73.8 bar
â€¢ Above critical: NO distinct liquid/gas phases (supercritical fluid)
â€¢ **Gas cooler** (not condenser) on high side

**Operating Pressures:**

**Summer Operation** (Ambient 35-40Â°C):
â€¢ **Gas cooler**: 80-120 bar (depending on ambient temp)
â€¢ **Evaporator**: 30-40 bar (-10Â°C to -5Â°C MT) or 10-15 bar (-35Â°C LT)
â€¢ **Pressure ratio**: 3-4:1 (high compression work)
â€¢ **Discharge temp**: 90-120Â°C (very hot)

**Winter Operation** (Ambient <25Â°C):
â€¢ **Condenser mode**: 50-70 bar (subcritical, below 31.1Â°C)
â€¢ **Evaporator**: Same 30-40 bar (MT) or 10-15 bar (LT)
â€¢ **Pressure ratio**: 2-2.5:1 (more efficient)
â€¢ **Discharge temp**: 70-90Â°C

**TK3+ 130bar Application:**
âœ… **Oil separator** (high side): Sees gas cooler pressure **80-120 bar**
âœ… **Compressor oil sump** (low side): Sees evaporator + oil pump **35-45 bar**
âœ… **Safety margin**: 10-50 bar (depending on location)

---

### **SUBCRITICAL CO2 SYSTEMS**

**Definition:**
â€¢ Operates **below critical point** year-round
â€¢ **Condenser** (not gas cooler) on high side
â€¢ Liquid/gas phases distinct

**Operating Pressures:**

**Typical Subcritical** (Cascade, Low-Temp):
â€¢ **Condenser**: 50-70 bar (-10Â°C to -5Â°C)
â€¢ **Evaporator**: 10-30 bar (-35Â°C to -20Â°C)
â€¢ **Pressure ratio**: 2-3:1
â€¢ **Discharge temp**: 60-80Â°C

**How to Keep Subcritical:**
â€¢ **Cascade system**: CO2 low stage, R404A/R134a high stage
  - CO2 condenses at -10Â°C to -5Â°C (50-70 bar)
  - R404A evaporator cools CO2 condenser
â€¢ **Cold climate**: Ambient <25Â°C year-round
â€¢ **Evaporative condenser**: Water spray cools CO2 to <31Â°C

**TK3+ 130bar Application:**
âœ… **Oil separator** (CO2 condenser side): **50-70 bar**
âœ… **Compressor oil sump**: **15-35 bar**
âœ… **Safety margin**: 60-80 bar (ample)

---

## PRESSURE CALCULATION FOR TK3+ SELECTION

**Step 1: Determine Design Conditions**

**Ambient Temperature:**
â€¢ Record **maximum summer** ambient (e.g., 40Â°C)
â€¢ Add **safety margin**: +5Â°C (climate change, urban heat island)
â€¢ **Design ambient**: 40Â°C + 5Â°C = **45Â°C**

**Gas Cooler Approach:**
â€¢ **Approach temperature**: Gas cooler exit temp - ambient
â€¢ Typical: **2-5Â°C** (efficient gas cooler)
â€¢ Poor: **8-10Â°C** (undersized, fouled)
â€¢ **Design**: Gas cooler exit = 45Â°C + 5Â°C = **50Â°C**

**Step 2: Calculate Gas Cooler Pressure**

**At 50Â°C, optimal pressure** (from CO2 tables):
â€¢ **Optimal pressure**: ~95-100 bar (max COP)
â€¢ **High pressure control** (HPC) regulates to optimal
â€¢ **Worst case** (HPC fails, manual setting): 110-120 bar

**Step 3: Add Oil Separator Pressure Drop**

â€¢ Oil separator Î”**P**: 2-5 bar (flow resistance)
â€¢ **Sensor pressure**: Gas cooler + Î”**P** separator
â€¢ **Example**: 100 bar + 3 bar = **103 bar**

**Step 4: Select TK3+ Model**

â€¢ **TK3+ 80bar**: Max 80 bar â†’ âŒ **INSUFFICIENT** (103 bar > 80 bar)
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: Max 130 bar â†’ âœ… **ADEQUATE** (27 bar margin)

**Safety Check:**
â€¢ **Recommended margin**: 20-30% below max rating
â€¢ **Safe operating**: 130 bar Ã— 0.7 = **91 bar continuous**
â€¢ **Acceptable peak**: 130 bar Ã— 0.9 = **117 bar transient**
â€¢ **103 bar**: âœ… Within safe operating range (28 bar margin)

---

## POE OIL SELECTION FOR CO2

### **Why POE is Mandatory**

**Mineral Oil Problems with CO2:**
âŒ **Immiscibility**: CO2 does NOT dissolve mineral oil
âŒ **Oil logging**: Mineral oil stays in evaporator (no return)
âŒ **Compressor failure**: Oil starvation in crankcase

**POE Oil Advantages:**
âœ… **Miscibility**: Polar POE dissolves in non-polar CO2
âœ… **Oil return**: CO2 velocity (>15 m/s) carries POE back
âœ… **Lubrication**: Excellent with CO2 (reduces wear)
âœ… **TK3+ detection**: Clear oil, high refractive index (optimal)

---

### **POE Viscosity Selection**

**ISO Viscosity Grades:**

**ISO 32** (Low Viscosity):
â€¢ **Application**: Scroll compressors, high-speed reciprocating
â€¢ **Temperature**: -10Â°C to +10Â°C evaporator (MT)
â€¢ **Advantages**: Low friction, good oil return
â€¢ **Disadvantages**: Thin film at high temp (>100Â°C discharge)

**ISO 46** (Medium Viscosity) - **MOST COMMON**:
â€¢ **Application**: Semi-hermetic reciprocating, scroll, screw
â€¢ **Temperature**: -35Â°C to +10Â°C (MT + LT)
â€¢ **Advantages**: Balanced protection + oil return
â€¢ **Recommended**: General-purpose CO2 systems

**ISO 68** (High Viscosity):
â€¢ **Application**: Screw compressors (oil-injected cooling)
â€¢ **Temperature**: -10Â°C to +20Â°C (MT, industrial)
â€¢ **Advantages**: Thick film at high temp, sealing
â€¢ **Disadvantages**: Slower oil return at low temp

**Selection Guide:**
â€¢ **Scroll compressors**: ISO 32 or ISO 46
â€¢ **Reciprocating (semi-hermetic)**: ISO 46
â€¢ **Screw compressors**: ISO 46 or ISO 68
â€¢ **LT (Low Temp) -35Â°C**: ISO 32 (better flow at low temp)
â€¢ **MT (Medium Temp) -10Â°C**: ISO 46

---

### **POE Oil Characteristics Affecting TK3+**

**Color:**
â€¢ **New POE**: Water-clear to pale yellow (excellent optical detection)
â€¢ **Used POE** (500-1000 hrs): Amber (slight darkening, still OK)
â€¢ **Contaminated POE**: Brown/black (carbon, acid) â†’ Clean TK3+ sensor

**Hygroscopic Nature:**
â€¢ POE absorbs moisture from air (up to 1000 ppm)
â€¢ **Moisture + CO2 + heat â†’ carbonic acid** (Hâ‚‚COâ‚ƒ)
â€¢ **Acid formation**: Corrodes metals, degrades POE
â€¢ **Prevention**:
  1. Store POE in sealed containers (nitrogen blanket)
  2. Install filter driers (moisture removal)
  3. Deep vacuum evacuation (<500 microns)
  4. Replace driers annually (or after acid test)

**Foaming:**
â€¢ CO2 dissolves in POE under pressure
â€¢ **Pressure drop** (expansion, startup) â†’ CO2 outgassing
â€¢ **Foam formation**: Oil + CO2 bubbles (like soda)
â€¢ **Impact on TK3+**: False LOW oil alarms (sensor sees bubbles, not oil)
â€¢ **Solution**: Programmable timer **5-7 seconds** (wait for foam to settle)

---

## CO2 SYSTEM CONFIGURATIONS

### **1. BOOSTER SYSTEM** (Supermarket)

**Components:**
â€¢ **MT (Medium Temp) Rack**: 3-6 compressors, -8Â°C evaporator, 30 bar suction
â€¢ **LT (Low Temp) Rack**: 2-4 compressors, -35Â°C evaporator, 10 bar suction
â€¢ **Gas cooler**: 80-120 bar, 35-40Â°C exit
â€¢ **Flash gas economizer**: MT discharge â†’ LT suction (intermediate pressure 45-55 bar)
â€¢ **Oil separator** (high side): After gas cooler, 80-120 bar
â€¢ **Oil reservoir**: Stores separated oil
â€¢ **Oil management**: Differential pressure (gas cooler â†’ compressor) pushes oil back

**TK3+ 130bar Locations:**

**Option A - Oil Separator** (Recommended):
â€¢ **Location**: High side, after gas cooler
â€¢ **Pressure**: 80-120 bar (full gas cooler pressure)
â€¢ **Advantage**: Monitors **total system oil** (all compressors)
â€¢ **Installation**: Flange mount on separator bottom port
â€¢ **Wiring**: Relay â†’ master shutdown (all compressors)
â€¢ **Timer**: 5-7 seconds (high turbulence in separator)

**Option B - Individual Compressors**:
â€¢ **Location**: Each compressor oil sump
â€¢ **Pressure**: 30-40 bar (MT suction + oil pump) or 10-15 bar (LT suction)
â€¢ **Advantage**: Individual compressor protection
â€¢ **Disadvantage**: Multiple sensors (cost), complex wiring
â€¢ **Use case**: Large racks (>6 compressors), critical redundancy

**Option C - Oil Reservoir**:
â€¢ **Location**: Intermediate pressure reservoir
â€¢ **Pressure**: 45-55 bar (flash gas bypass)
â€¢ **Advantage**: Monitors stored oil (backup for compressors)
â€¢ **Combination**: Oil separator (primary) + reservoir (secondary)

---

### **2. TRANSCRITICAL PACK** (Small Supermarket, C-Store)

**Components:**
â€¢ **1-2 compressors** (reciprocating or scroll)
â€¢ **Gas cooler** (adiabatic/evaporative): 80-100 bar
â€¢ **Evaporator** (MT or MT+LT): -8Â°C to -35Â°C
â€¢ **High-pressure receiver**: After gas cooler, stores liquid CO2
â€¢ **Oil separator**: Optional (small systems may omit)

**TK3+ 130bar Location:**

**With Oil Separator:**
â€¢ Install on separator (80-100 bar)
â€¢ Relay â†’ compressor shutdown

**Without Oil Separator:**
â€¢ Install on **compressor oil sump** (30-40 bar suction pressure)
â€¢ **Note**: Lower pressure (TK3+ 80bar could work, but 130bar recommended for safety margin)

**Timer Setting:**
â€¢ **Small system** (1-2 compressors): 3-5 seconds
â€¢ **Reason**: Less oil volume, less turbulence vs. booster rack

---

### **3. CASCADE SYSTEM** (Ultra-Low Temp)

**Components:**

**Low Stage (CO2):**
â€¢ **Evaporator**: -35Â°C to -55Â°C (frozen food, pharmaceuticals)
â€¢ **Condenser** (cascade): -10Â°C to -5Â°C, 50-70 bar
â€¢ **Compressor**: Reciprocating or screw
â€¢ **Oil separator**: After CO2 compressor, 50-70 bar

**High Stage (R404A or R134a):**
â€¢ **Evaporator** (cascade condenser): -15Â°C to -10Â°C
â€¢ **Condenser**: +30Â°C to +40Â°C
â€¢ **Compressor**: Standard HFC compressor

**TK3+ Sensor Selection:**
â€¢ **CO2 compressor** (low stage): **TK3+ 130bar** (50-70 bar condenser pressure)
  - Install on CO2 oil separator (50-70 bar)
  - POE oil (CO2-compatible)
â€¢ **R404A compressor** (high stage): **TK3+ 46bar** (16-20 bar condenser pressure)
  - Install on R404A compressor oil sump (12-16 bar)
  - POE or mineral oil (R404A-compatible)

**Why 130bar for Subcritical CO2 (50-70 bar)?**
â€¢ **TK3+ 80bar**: Marginal (10 bar margin only)
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: Ample (60 bar margin)
â€¢ **Safety**: Pressure transients (startup, defrost) could spike to 80-90 bar
â€¢ **Recommendation**: Use 130bar for all CO2 systems (peace of mind)

---

## OIL RETURN IN CO2 SYSTEMS

**Critical Velocity:**
â€¢ CO2 must flow fast enough to carry POE oil
â€¢ **Minimum velocity**: 15 m/s (horizontal pipes), 7 m/s (vertical risers)
â€¢ **Below minimum**: Oil logging (oil stays in evaporator, doesn't return)

**Pipe Sizing:**
â€¢ **Undersized pipes**: High velocity (good oil return), high Î”**P** (pressure drop)
â€¢ **Oversized pipes**: Low velocity (poor oil return), low Î”**P**
â€¢ **Optimal**: Velocity 15-20 m/s (balance)

**Compressor Cycling:**
â€¢ **Frequent cycling**: CO2 velocity drops during off-cycle (oil logging)
â€¢ **Long run times**: Better oil return (sustained velocity)
â€¢ **Booster racks**: Always 1+ compressor running (continuous velocity)

**TK3+ 130bar Role:**
â€¢ **Monitors oil level** (early warning of oil logging)
â€¢ **If LOW oil alarm**: Check evaporator oil return (velocity, pipe sizing)
â€¢ **4-20mA trending**: Gradual oil loss indicates oil logging (vs. sudden loss = leak)

---

## SYSTEM SAFETY & PRESSURE RELIEF

**Overpressure Scenarios:**

**1. High-Pressure Control (HPC) Failure:**
â€¢ HPC valve stuck closed â†’ gas cooler pressure rises
â€¢ **Normal**: 100 bar â†’ **Failure**: 120-140 bar
â€¢ **Protection**:
  1. **High-pressure switch**: Cut-out @ 115 bar (compressor shutdown)
  2. **PRV (Pressure Relief Valve)**: Opens @ 120 bar (vent CO2)
  3. **TK3+ 130bar**: Survives (195 bar test pressure)

**2. Ambient Temperature Spike:**
â€¢ **Heat wave**: Ambient 40Â°C â†’ 48Â°C (sudden)
â€¢ Gas cooler pressure: 100 bar â†’ 115 bar
â€¢ **Protection**: HPC modulates (optimal pressure), high-pressure cut-out

**3. Gas Cooler Fan Failure:**
â€¢ Fans stop â†’ poor heat rejection â†’ pressure rises
â€¢ **Rate**: +5-10 bar per minute
â€¢ **Protection**: High-pressure cut-out (before 130 bar reached)

**PRV Sizing:**
â€¢ **Set point**: 120 bar (below TK3+ 130 bar rating)
â€¢ **Capacity**: Must vent full compressor flow (kg/h)
â€¢ **Discharge**: To outdoor (safe location, not near people)
â€¢ **Testing**: Annual (verify opens at 120 bar)

---

## CO2 CHARGE & OIL CHARGE

**CO2 Refrigerant Charge:**
â€¢ **Transcritical**: 0.5-1.5 kg per kW refrigeration
â€¢ **Subcritical**: 0.3-0.8 kg per kW
â€¢ **Example**: 50 kW system â†’ 25-75 kg CO2
â€¢ **Charge method**: Weigh in (liquid CO2 from cylinder)

**POE Oil Charge:**
â€¢ **Compressor oil sump**: Per manufacturer spec (e.g., 5-10 liters per compressor)
â€¢ **Oil separator**: 2-5 liters (depending on size)
â€¢ **Total system oil**: 10-30 liters (booster rack)

**Oil Level Setpoint:**
â€¢ **TK3+ location**: Sight glass level (middle of sight glass = sensor tip height)
â€¢ **Alarm level**: 50% of sight glass (oil LOW â†’ compressor shutdown)
â€¢ **Refill level**: 70-80% of sight glass (normal operating level)

**Oil Loss Rate:**
â€¢ **Normal**: <0.5 liters/year (CO2 carries minimal oil to evaporators)
â€¢ **High loss** (>2 liters/year): Oil logging, leak, compressor wear
â€¢ **TK3+ 4-20mA trending**: Track oil level over weeks/months (detect gradual loss)

---

## COMMISSIONING CHECKLIST (TK3+ 130bar + CO2)

**Pre-Installation:**
âœ… **System design**: Pressure calculations (gas cooler 80-120 bar)
âœ… **TK3+ 130bar selected**: Pressure <130 bar (safety margin)
âœ… **POE oil selected**: ISO 46 (general), ISO 32 (scroll), ISO 68 (screw)
âœ… **Flange adapter** (if needed): Compressor brand compatibility

**Installation:**
âœ… **Sensor location**: Oil separator (primary) or compressor sump
âœ… **Mounting**: Vertical (tip down), torque 15-20 Nm, new Viton gasket
âœ… **Wiring**: Pin 1-2 power, Pin 3-4-5 relay, Pin 6-7 analog
âœ… **Shielded cable**: Ground at controller (not compressor)

**System Preparation:**
âœ… **Deep vacuum**: <500 microns (remove moisture, prevent acid)
âœ… **Filter driers**: 2Ã— capacity (POE hygroscopic)
âœ… **Leak test**: 10 bar nitrogen, soap bubble test (all flanges)
âœ… **CO2 charge**: Weigh in per design (kg)
âœ… **POE oil charge**: Fill compressor sump to 70% sight glass

**TK3+ Configuration:**
âœ… **Power ON**: Verify 24V DC (21.6-26.4V), LED illuminates
âœ… **LED test**: Green (oil OK), Red (oil LOW) - tilt sensor to test
âœ… **Relay test**: Multimeter (contact switches with oil level)
âœ… **4-20mA test**: Clamp meter or PLC (20 mA oil OK, 4 mA oil LOW)
âœ… **Timer adjustment**: 5-7 seconds (CO2 booster), 3-5 seconds (transcritical pack)
âœ… **Alarm wiring**: Relay â†’ PLC/BMS (compressor shutdown logic)

**Startup:**
âœ… **Compressor start**: Monitor oil level (sight glass + TK3+ LED)
âœ… **Oil return**: Verify oil returns after 30 minutes (check evaporator sight glass)
âœ… **Pressure check**: Gas cooler 80-120 bar (within TK3+ rating)
âœ… **Timer verification**: Transient alarms (startup) clear after timer delay
âœ… **Trending**: Log 4-20mA over 24 hours (establish baseline)

**Post-Commissioning:**
âœ… **Documentation**: Record TK3+ serial number, installation date, timer setting
âœ… **Training**: Operator training (LED meaning, LOW oil action)
âœ… **Maintenance schedule**: 6-month inspection, 12-month cleaning
âœ… **Spare parts**: Stock Viton gaskets (â‚¬2-5 each), IPA 99%, lint-free cloths

---

**SUMMARY - CO2 SYSTEM DESIGN QUICK REFERENCE:**

âœ… **Transcritical**: Gas cooler 80-120 bar â†’ TK3+ 130bar MANDATORY
âœ… **Subcritical**: Condenser 50-70 bar â†’ TK3+ 130bar RECOMMENDED (60 bar margin)
âœ… **POE oil**: ISO 46 (general), ISO 32 (scroll/LT), ISO 68 (screw)
âœ… **Timer**: 5-7 seconds (booster rack), 3-5 seconds (transcritical pack)
âœ… **Location**: Oil separator (primary), compressor sump (secondary)
âœ… **Safety margin**: 20-30% below 130 bar rating (91-117 bar safe)
âœ… **PRV**: Set @ 120 bar (below sensor rating)
âœ… **Oil return**: Minimum velocity 15 m/s (horizontal), 7 m/s (vertical)
âœ… **Moisture control**: Deep vacuum <500 microns, filter driers 2Ã—
âœ… **Commissioning**: Pressure test, functional test, timer adjustment, trending

**TK3+ 130bar - CO2 System Design & Technical Requirements**

Comprehensive guide for designing CO2 refrigeration systems with TK3+ 130bar, including pressure calculations, POE oil selection, and system configurations.

---

## TRANSCRITICAL vs. SUBCRITICAL CO2

### **Transcritical CO2**

**Definition**: Operates **above critical point** (31.1Â°C @ 73.8 bar)

**Summer (35-40Â°C Ambient):**
â€¢ **Gas cooler**: 80-120 bar (no liquid/gas phases)
â€¢ **Evaporator**: 30-40 bar (MT) or 10-15 bar (LT)
â€¢ Pressure ratio: 3-4:1
â€¢ Discharge temp: 90-120Â°C

**Winter (<25Â°C Ambient):**
â€¢ **Condenser mode**: 50-70 bar (subcritical)
â€¢ Pressure ratio: 2-2.5:1
â€¢ Discharge temp: 70-90Â°C

**TK3+ 130bar:**
âœ… Oil separator (high side): **80-120 bar**
âœ… Compressor sump (low side): **35-45 bar**
âœ… Safety margin: 10-50 bar

---

### **Subcritical CO2**

**Definition**: Operates **below critical point** year-round

**Typical Subcritical:**
â€¢ **Condenser**: 50-70 bar (-10Â°C to -5Â°C)
â€¢ **Evaporator**: 10-30 bar (-35Â°C to -20Â°C)
â€¢ Pressure ratio: 2-3:1
â€¢ Discharge temp: 60-80Â°C

**How to Keep Subcritical:**
â€¢ **Cascade**: CO2 low stage + R404A/R134a high stage
â€¢ **Cold climate**: Ambient <25Â°C year-round
â€¢ **Evaporative condenser**: Water spray <31Â°C

**TK3+ 130bar:**
âœ… Oil separator: **50-70 bar**
âœ… Compressor sump: **15-35 bar**
âœ… Safety margin: 60-80 bar

---

## PRESSURE CALCULATION FOR TK3+ SELECTION

**Step 1: Design Conditions**
â€¢ Max summer ambient: e.g., 40Â°C
â€¢ Safety margin: +5Â°C
â€¢ **Design ambient**: 45Â°C

**Step 2: Gas Cooler Pressure**
â€¢ Approach temp: 2-5Â°C (efficient) or 8-10Â°C (poor)
â€¢ Gas cooler exit: 45Â°C + 5Â°C = 50Â°C
â€¢ **Optimal pressure @ 50Â°C**: 95-100 bar
â€¢ **Worst case** (HPC fail): 110-120 bar

**Step 3: Oil Separator Î”**P**
â€¢ Separator pressure drop: 2-5 bar
â€¢ **Sensor pressure**: 100 bar + 3 bar = **103 bar**

**Step 4: Select TK3+**
â€¢ **TK3+ 80bar**: Max 80 bar â†’ âŒ INSUFFICIENT
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: Max 130 bar â†’ âœ… ADEQUATE (27 bar margin)

**Safety Check:**
â€¢ Recommended margin: 20-30%
â€¢ Safe operating: 130 Ã— 0.7 = **91 bar continuous**
â€¢ Acceptable peak: 130 Ã— 0.9 = **117 bar transient**
â€¢ **103 bar**: âœ… Within safe range (28 bar margin)

---

## POE OIL SELECTION FOR CO2

### **Why POE is Mandatory**

**Mineral Oil Problems:**
âŒ Immiscibility: CO2 doesn't dissolve mineral oil
âŒ Oil logging: Oil stays in evaporator
âŒ Compressor failure: Oil starvation

**POE Advantages:**
âœ… Miscibility: Polar POE dissolves in CO2
âœ… Oil return: CO2 velocity (>15 m/s) carries POE back
âœ… Lubrication: Excellent with CO2
âœ… TK3+ detection: Clear oil, high refractive index

---

### **POE Viscosity Selection**

**ISO 32** (Low Viscosity):
â€¢ Scroll compressors, high-speed reciprocating
â€¢ Temp: -10Â°C to +10Â°C (MT)
â€¢ Advantage: Low friction, good oil return
â€¢ Disadvantage: Thin film at high temp (>100Â°C)

**ISO 46** (Medium) - **MOST COMMON**:
â€¢ Semi-hermetic reciprocating, scroll, screw
â€¢ Temp: -35Â°C to +10Â°C (MT + LT)
â€¢ Advantage: Balanced protection + oil return
â€¢ **Recommended**: General-purpose CO2

**ISO 68** (High Viscosity):
â€¢ Screw compressors (oil-injected cooling)
â€¢ Temp: -10Â°C to +20Â°C (MT, industrial)
â€¢ Advantage: Thick film, sealing
â€¢ Disadvantage: Slower return at low temp

**Selection Guide:**
â€¢ **Scroll**: ISO 32 or 46
â€¢ **Reciprocating**: ISO 46
â€¢ **Screw**: ISO 46 or 68
â€¢ **LT (-35Â°C)**: ISO 32 (better flow)
â€¢ **MT (-10Â°C)**: ISO 46

---

### **POE Characteristics Affecting TK3+**

**Color:**
â€¢ **New**: Water-clear to pale yellow (excellent detection)
â€¢ **Used** (500-1000 hrs): Amber (slight darkening, OK)
â€¢ **Contaminated**: Brown/black (carbon, acid) â†’ Clean sensor

**Hygroscopic:**
â€¢ POE absorbs moisture (up to 1000 ppm)
â€¢ **Moisture + CO2 + heat â†’ carbonic acid**
â€¢ **Prevention**:
  1. Sealed containers (nitrogen blanket)
  2. Filter driers (moisture removal)
  3. Deep vacuum (<500 microns)
  4. Replace driers annually

**Foaming:**
â€¢ CO2 dissolves in POE under pressure
â€¢ Pressure drop â†’ CO2 outgassing (like soda)
â€¢ **Foam**: Oil + CO2 bubbles
â€¢ **TK3+ impact**: False LOW alarms (sees bubbles)
â€¢ **Solution**: Timer **5-7 seconds** (wait for foam)

---

## CO2 SYSTEM CONFIGURATIONS

### **1. BOOSTER SYSTEM** (Supermarket)

**Components:**
â€¢ **MT Rack**: 3-6 compressors, -8Â°C, 30 bar suction
â€¢ **LT Rack**: 2-4 compressors, -35Â°C, 10 bar suction
â€¢ **Gas cooler**: 80-120 bar
â€¢ **Flash gas economizer**: 45-55 bar intermediate
â€¢ **Oil separator**: High side, 80-120 bar

**TK3+ 130bar Locations:**

**Option A - Oil Separator** (Recommended):
â€¢ Pressure: **80-120 bar**
â€¢ Advantage: Monitors **total system oil**
â€¢ Wiring: Relay â†’ master shutdown (all compressors)
â€¢ Timer: **5-7 seconds** (high turbulence)

**Option B - Individual Compressors**:
â€¢ Pressure: 30-40 bar (MT) or 10-15 bar (LT)
â€¢ Advantage: Individual protection
â€¢ Use: Large racks (>6 compressors)

**Option C - Oil Reservoir**:
â€¢ Pressure: 45-55 bar (flash gas)
â€¢ Combination: Separator (primary) + reservoir (secondary)

---

### **2. TRANSCRITICAL PACK** (Small Supermarket)

**Components:**
â€¢ 1-2 compressors (reciprocating/scroll)
â€¢ Gas cooler: 80-100 bar
â€¢ Evaporator: -8Â°C to -35Â°C
â€¢ Oil separator: Optional (small systems)

**TK3+ 130bar:**
â€¢ **With separator**: Install on separator (80-100 bar)
â€¢ **Without**: Compressor sump (30-40 bar)
â€¢ **Timer**: 3-5 seconds (less turbulence)

---

### **3. CASCADE SYSTEM** (Ultra-Low Temp)

**Low Stage (CO2):**
â€¢ Evaporator: -35Â°C to -55Â°C
â€¢ Condenser (cascade): -10Â°C to -5Â°C, **50-70 bar**
â€¢ Oil separator: **50-70 bar**
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar** (60 bar margin)

**High Stage (R404A):**
â€¢ Evaporator (cascade): -15Â°C to -10Â°C
â€¢ Condenser: +30Â°C to +40Â°C
â€¢ **TK3+ 46bar** (sufficient)

**Why 130bar for Subcritical (50-70 bar)?**
â€¢ **TK3+ 80bar**: Marginal (10 bar margin)
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: Ample (60 bar margin)
â€¢ **Transients**: Startup/defrost spikes to 80-90 bar

---

## OIL RETURN IN CO2 SYSTEMS

**Critical Velocity:**
â€¢ **Minimum**: 15 m/s (horizontal), 7 m/s (vertical risers)
â€¢ **Below minimum**: Oil logging (oil stays in evaporator)

**Pipe Sizing:**
â€¢ Undersized: High velocity (good return), high Î”**P**
â€¢ Oversized: Low velocity (poor return), low Î”**P**
â€¢ **Optimal**: 15-20 m/s (balance)

**TK3+ 130bar Role:**
â€¢ Monitors oil level (early warning of logging)
â€¢ **LOW alarm**: Check evaporator oil return
â€¢ **4-20mA trending**: Gradual loss = logging (vs. sudden = leak)

---

## SYSTEM SAFETY & PRESSURE RELIEF

**Overpressure Scenarios:**

1. **HPC Failure**: 100 â†’ 120-140 bar
   - Protection: Cut-out @ 115 bar, PRV @ 120 bar

2. **Ambient Spike**: 40Â°C â†’ 48Â°C (heat wave)
   - 100 â†’ 115 bar

3. **Fan Failure**: +5-10 bar/minute
   - Cut-out before 130 bar

**PRV Sizing:**
â€¢ Set point: **120 bar** (below TK3+ rating)
â€¢ Capacity: Full compressor flow (kg/h)
â€¢ Discharge: Outdoor safe location
â€¢ Testing: Annual (verify opens @ 120 bar)

---

## CO2 CHARGE & OIL CHARGE

**CO2 Refrigerant:**
â€¢ Transcritical: 0.5-1.5 kg per kW
â€¢ Subcritical: 0.3-0.8 kg per kW
â€¢ Example: 50 kW â†’ 25-75 kg CO2
â€¢ Method: Weigh in (liquid from cylinder)

**POE Oil:**
â€¢ Compressor sump: 5-10 liters per compressor
â€¢ Oil separator: 2-5 liters
â€¢ Total (booster): 10-30 liters

**Oil Level Setpoint:**
â€¢ TK3+ location: Middle of sight glass
â€¢ Alarm: 50% (LOW â†’ shutdown)
â€¢ Normal: 70-80% (operating level)

**Oil Loss Rate:**
â€¢ Normal: <0.5 liters/year
â€¢ High (>2 liters/year): Logging, leak, wear
â€¢ **4-20mA trending**: Track over weeks/months

---

## COMMISSIONING CHECKLIST

**Pre-Installation:**
âœ… Pressure calculations (gas cooler 80-120 bar)
âœ… TK3+ 130bar selected (pressure <130 bar)
âœ… POE oil: ISO 46 (general), ISO 32 (scroll), ISO 68 (screw)
âœ… Flange adapter (if needed)

**Installation:**
âœ… Location: Oil separator (primary) or compressor sump
âœ… Mounting: Vertical (tip down), 15-20 Nm, new gasket
âœ… Wiring: Pin 1-2 power, 3-4-5 relay, 6-7 analog
âœ… Shielded cable: Ground at controller

**System Preparation:**
âœ… Deep vacuum: <500 microns (remove moisture)
âœ… Filter driers: 2Ã— capacity (POE hygroscopic)
âœ… Leak test: 10 bar nitrogen, soap bubble
âœ… CO2 charge: Weigh in per design
âœ… POE oil: Fill to 70% sight glass

**TK3+ Configuration:**
âœ… Power: 24V DC, LED illuminates
âœ… LED test: Green (OK), Red (LOW)
âœ… Relay test: Multimeter (contact switches)
âœ… 4-20mA test: 20 mA (OK), 4 mA (LOW)
âœ… **Timer**: 5-7s (booster), 3-5s (transcritical pack)
âœ… Alarm wiring: Relay â†’ PLC/BMS shutdown

**Startup:**
âœ… Compressor start: Monitor oil level (sight glass + LED)
âœ… Oil return: Verify after 30 minutes
âœ… Pressure: Gas cooler 80-120 bar (within rating)
âœ… Timer: Transient alarms clear after delay
âœ… Trending: Log 4-20mA over 24 hours (baseline)

**Post-Commissioning:**
âœ… Documentation: Serial number, date, timer setting
âœ… Training: Operator (LED meaning, LOW action)
âœ… Maintenance: 6-month inspection, 12-month cleaning
âœ… Spares: Gaskets (â‚¬2-5), IPA 99%, cloths

---

## SUMMARY - QUICK REFERENCE

âœ… **Transcritical**: 80-120 bar â†’ TK3+ 130bar MANDATORY
âœ… **Subcritical**: 50-70 bar â†’ TK3+ 130bar RECOMMENDED (60 bar margin)
âœ… **POE**: ISO 46 (general), ISO 32 (scroll/LT), ISO 68 (screw)
âœ… **Timer**: 5-7s (booster), 3-5s (transcritical pack)
âœ… **Location**: Oil separator (primary), compressor sump (secondary)
âœ… **Safety margin**: 20-30% (91-117 bar safe)
âœ… **PRV**: 120 bar (below sensor rating)
âœ… **Oil return**: 15 m/s (horizontal), 7 m/s (vertical)
âœ… **Moisture**: Vacuum <500 microns, driers 2Ã—
âœ… **Commissioning**: Pressure test, functional test, timer, trending
